alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 29 at 2:36PM MST until June 29 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON FOR THE PIPELINE AND TUNNEL BURN SCARS IN COCONINO COUNTY... At 234 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated the heavy rain across the Pipeline and Tunnel burn scars has decreased in intensity. However, flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly as water drains with light to moderate rainfall continuing. Excessive rainfall over the burn scars will result in debris flow moving through the Timberline, Wapatki Trails, and Fernwood Hills. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Wupatki Trails, Fernwood, Timberline, Bonito Campground At Sunset Crater, Hutchison Acres, Sunset Crater Volcano National Monument, Sunset Crater Visitors Center and Lockett Meadow Campground. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 89 between mile markers 424 and 432. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Deadman Wash, Schultz Creek and Kanaa Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Avoid recently burned areas and downstream locations. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry washes will occur. Rockslides and mudslides will likely occur in steep terrain. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding of washes and creeks will occur, some dirt roads will become muddy and impassable. Paved roads and underpasses could become flooded as well.
